title: How did colonization benefit the Spanish? - Quora

response.answer_text: They exploited the huge material resources of the Americas, especially abundant gold and silver deposits but also copper, precious stones and spices, which made Spain the richest country in Europe and maybe the world for two and a half centuries and even after that kept the Spanish royal court as the richest and most opulent in the world probably until the late 18th century; and it enabled Spain to reap the benefits of millions of Indians (and later millions of transplanted Africans as well) as slave labor for three and a quarter centuries; and it provided Spain with a trading monopoly with the Spanish colonies in the Americas for over three centuries.

The answer is easy: Spain gained access to a seemingly endless amount of resources of all kinds such as precious metals (silver and gold) and wealth through agriculture by growing sugar, tobacco and other crops in high demand in Europe and elsewhere. Many an hidalgo (a man from the Spanish lower and impoverished nobility) made a huge fortune from running lands, mines, factories and other kinds of business operations in America.
